title: Miami condo collapse: A boom, then the ground shook
description: Witnesses recount the terrifying night of the Champlain Tower collapse and the week that shook Miami.

title: Week in pictures: 26 June - 2 July 2021
description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

title: Euro 2020: Ukrainians unite over football after years of struggle
description: Hit by years of war and long months of Covid lockdown, Ukrainians dare to dream of football success.

title: Why are Chinese tech brands flocking to Euro 2020?
description: Four big Chinese firms have signed up to sponsor the European football tournament this year.

title: Meet Tai Verdes, the rising star who funded his career by winning a dating show
description: Tai Verdes didn't know how to make it in the music industry - but a reality TV jackpot sorted that out.

title: Then and now: Arctic sea-ice feeling the heat
description: As Arctic sea-ice melts in a warming world, it causes the world to heat more rapidly.

title: 'I used drugs every day in lockdown, but now I'm drug-free'
description: Lee says he went from using drugs once a week to every day during the lockdown - but now he's in recovery.

title: 'Hiking as a black person in the US can be nerve-racking'
description: Mardi is part of Outdoor Afro, an organisation which encourages black nature lovers into the outdoors.

title: The cat with more than 50,000 social media followers
description: Pet influencers have become the latest social media stars with the pandemic fuelling content demand.

title: 'A signal Italy are here to win Euro 2020' - but agony for 'irreplaceable' Spinazzola
description: There has been no better team than Italy at Euro 2020 and they are now two games from glory after dumping out Belgium - so how far can they go?

title: Wimbledon 2021: Andy Murray on losing to Denis Shapovalov
description: Andy Murray says he needs to weigh up "if all the hard work is worth it" after an encouraging run at Wimbledon is ended by Canada's Denis Shapovalov.

title: Euro 2020: Watch all the angles of Lorenzo Insigne's stunning strike for Italy
description: Watch all the angles of Lorenzo Insigne's beautiful curling strike to put Italy 2-0 up against Belgium in their quarter-final tie in Munich.

title: Wimbledon 2021: Britain's Andy Murray loses in straight sets to Canada's Denis Shapovalov
description: Watch highlights as Andy Murray's run at Wimbledon comes to end with a third-round 6-4 6-2 6-2 defeat by Canadian Denis Shapovalov.

title: The codes helping visually-impaired people shop
description: New technology that allows phones to read out labelling is about to make supermarkets much more accessible.

title: Ukraine stand in way of England and a first Euro semi-final in 25 years
description: England will attempt to qualify for their first European Championship semi-final for 25 years when they face Ukraine at Euro 2020 on Saturday.

title: How dogs are helping the Surfside rescue effort
description: From trauma therapy to search and rescue, these dogs are playing a pivotal role in recovery

title: England v Ukraine: Three Lions' defence is perfect platform for Euro 2020 success - Rio Ferdinand
description: Former England defender and BBC Sport columnist Rio Ferdinand says the Three Lions' strength as a unit at the back has become their biggest strength as a team.

title: When in Rome... The England fans at the match
description: England fans with tickets for Saturday's quarter-final tell us how they've managed to get there.

title: Canada: Statues of Victoria and Elizabeth toppled over indigenous deaths
description: Monuments are torn down in Manitoba at a protest over the deaths of indigenous Canadian children.

title: Prosecutors drop Troubles cases against ex-soldiers
description: Two Army veterans had faced murder charges over deaths in Londonderry in 1972, including on Bloody Sunday.

title: Covid: Britons reassured over India-made Covishield jabs and EU travel
description: Vaccine expert Adam Finn says the jab is "exactly the same", describing the issue as "administrative".

title: Bagram: Last US and Nato forces leave key Afghanistan base
description: The sprawling airbase has been the centre of operations against the Taliban and al-Qaeda for almost 20 years.

title: Batley and Spen: Labour is back after by-election win, says Starmer
description: Sir Keir Starmer hails Kim Leadbeater's victory in Batley and Spen as "just the start" for his party.

title: Fire-and-rehire: What is it and why is it controversial?
description: Controversy surrounds companies which dismiss their workers and rehire them on worse contracts.

title: Man charged with common assault after Chris Whitty incident
description: A group of men were seen accosting England's chief medical officer in a park on Sunday.

title: Austrian Grand Prix: Red Bull's Max Verstappen fastest in first practice
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen sets the pace in first practice at the Austrian Grand Prix, with title rival Lewis Hamilton's Mercedes down in seventh.

title: Microsoft’s Windows 11 blue screen of death to become black
description: The new colour in the Windows 11 operating system matches the new black logon and shutdown screens.

title: Harlequins fly-half Smith to make England debut against USA
description: Harlequins fly-half Marcus Smith makes his eagerly awaited England debut, with Gloucester's Lewis Ludlow captain against the United States on Sunday.

title: Karen Carney column: Experiencing Euro 2020 as a pitchside reporter
description: In her latest BBC Sport column, Karen Carney discusses what she has seen as a pitchside reporter at Euro 2020.

title: Euros archive: Life before goalline technology - England v Ukraine in 2012
description: Relive the last time England faced Ukraine at the European Championship in 2012.

title: Batley and Spen: How Labour held on - and what it means for Sir Keir Starmer
description: Holding Batley and Spen will feel like a by-election gain for Labour - so how did they do it?

title: Asda to allow permanent hybrid working for offices
description: The supermarket says most of its 4,000 head office staff can choose to work at home or other locations.

title: Norwich sign Chelsea and Scotland midfielder Gilmour on loan
description: Norwich City sign Scotland midfielder Billy Gilmour on a season-long from Chelsea.

title: Kim Leadbeater: Sister of Jo Cox is new Batley and Spen MP
description: Kim Leadbeater says a key part of her by-election success was being "born and bred" in the area.

title: Bobby Gillespie and Jehnny Beth: 'Brexit has destroyed any hope for young musicians'

title: Love Island: ITV condemns death threats sent to contestant Chloe Burrows
description: Messages sent to contestant Chloe Burrows online were "wholly unacceptable", the broadcaster says.

title: Batley and Spen: Fraught by-election concludes in dramatic fashion
description: How drama built as Labour retained its Batley and Spen seat by a narrow margin.

title: The Papers: 'Reunited for Diana' and 'Freedom Day warning'
description: Friday's papers include a statue of Diana, and the PM's warning over plans for lifting England's lockdown.

title: Saskia Jones: Family say event organisers should stand down
description: They say organisers of an event, where a convicted terrorist killed two people, should step down.

title: Strolling crocodile sparks panic in India village
description: Wildlife officials caught the animal and released it into a nearby river.
